content: Over the past few days, General Motors as well as The Chryser Corporation have announced the closures of dealerships throughout the country. If what I have read in the "Arizona Daily Star" (Tucson), as well as via the local CBS station (KOLD TV Channel 13), partly to blame rests on the poor selling numbers, as well as the number of 'multiple dealerships selling the same brands'. What impact is this having in your area? Luckily, in the Tucson area, where I live, no one has been snake bit...yet.

title: Automobile Dealership Closings

content: A Chrysler dealership to the north of us is losing it's Chrysler franchise, but they also have Toyota franchise so they'll go on (not to mention that they're part of a BUNCH of franchises all owned by one company selling basically every major brand available. Another dealer just up the road from me is losing it's Jeep dealership, but they also do Buick and Pontiac; but then again, Pontiac will be ceasing existance, and GM is pulling franchises as well so their Buick franchise could well go bye-bye too! That would be it for them! It is not our belief or disbelief that can make or unmake the fact. ~ Thomas Paine

title: Automobile Dealership Closings

content: We are losing one chysler dealer. Don't know about GM yet. It looks like life as we knew it growing up has changed and I am not certain that it is for the better. I remember when I was young we could hardly wait until October when the dealers would have a big showing of the newest models of their cars. They would have hollywood spotlights, millions of balloons and cake and coffee. Hundreds of people would go to the car lot and checkout the new cars. Us kids would go and get brochures of the neatest cars to put on our bedroom walls and state that that was what we were going to get when we grew up. Now days we never know when the new cars arrive at the dealers. Now some of the dealers won't be there anymore. An era has come and gone.

content: So far, one dealer has closed here. A dealer closing not only affects the people working for the dealer, it affects business' who depend business due to the dealer! Keep smiling, everyone will wonder what you've been up to!

content: Of what I caught tonite was that Chrysler has ordered nearly 800 dealerships, totalling well over 44 thousand vehicles, to close up shop... The unaffected dealerships will be crunching numbers as well...literally slicing prices by double digit percentages...just to get them off the lot. Haven't seen the overall numbers for GM...yet. Dayem! I'm glad I still have my 23 year old car...runs like new, thanks for the maintenance kept up Still looks pretty damn good, too!

content: quote: Originally posted by sargeant_green: Golly Gosh "Hoffster" The country DID vote for change. What? They don't like the kind of change their getting? Sucitup! Those who did literally 'sell their collective souls' for this 'change' will begin to wake up and see the nightmare for it really is. I'm guessing that some of these people are going to be those directly, if not indirectly, affected by the demise of the US automotive industry... With that in mind, they will be some of the most vocal opponents of this 'change'... Those who are employed in the industries that provide material support will be drastically and dangerously affected as well...and we're talking thousands of large and small 'cottage industries'... There's going to be Hell to pay for this in the long run.
